item.title: Overall Description
item.description:
Article Data information:
- Descriptive information about exomic analysis of the 12 patients with Syndromic Skin HS disorder: PASH, PAPASH and PASH/SAPHO.

Table S1:

ID group All ExonVar FuncVar ImpactVar Rare

HSM2 PASH 93227 30981 386 3971 2782

HSM24 PASH 134019 34394 382 4155 4621

HSM3 PASH 98429 31540 388 3982 3156
HSM4 PASH 94473 31321 341 3947 2901
HSM5 PASH 99191 31294 342 3817 2786

FunctVar: Functional variant;
ImpactVar: Variants with a prediction impact higher than 1 or CADD >=15.

item.title: Group Comparisons
item.description:
Article Data information:
- Descriptive information about exomic analysis of the 12 patients with Syndromic Skin HS disorder: PASH, PAPASH and PASH/SAPHO.

Figure S5:

Figure S5: Venn diagram of common FunctVar

Table S3.1:

Table S3.1: List of the 54 common FunctVar present on papash patient's group not common on pash and sapho groups

ImpactVar: Variants with a prediction impact higher than 1 or CADD >=15.

item.title: Variant Enrichment Analysis
item.description:
VEA Group Analysis
- Descriptive information about exomic analysis pathway of the 12 patients with Syndromic Skin HS disorder grouped as PASH, PAPASH and PASH/SAPHO.

To access individual information of VEA, click here

To access Groups information of filtered VEA (Features), click here

Filtered VEA (Features):

Figure S7:

Figure S7: Venn diagram of common filtered (Features) Enriched Pathways per each group

Table S10.1:

Table S10.1: List of 15 common Enriched Pathways in PAPASH Group

*these pathways could be found in the skin during skin inflammations

Table S10.2:

Table S10.2: List of 25 common Enriched Pathways in PASH Group

*these pathways could be found in the skin during skin inflammations

Table S10.3:

Table S10.3: List of 12 common Enriched Pathways in PASH/SAPHO Group

*these pathways could be found in the skin during skin inflammations

Variant Enrichment Analysis to Explore Pathways Functionality in complex autoinflammatory skin disorders through Whole Exome Sequencing analysis.
